justification: Participants rated their confidence in their decision on a 6-point scale ranging from 'sure error' to 'certainly correct'. This scale directly measures their perceived level of confidence associated with their decision regarding the color dominance of the dots.

Feedback values were manipulated between 'high' and 'low' conditions across trial blocks, with these values reflecting model-predicted confidence. This manipulation allowed for the assessment of prediction error between participants' internal confidence estimates and external feedback.

The DLDC model was used to capture participants' dynamic updating of confidence based on feedback. It minimized the prediction error between feedback and confidence, updating parameters α and β trial-by-trial to reflect changes in confidence computation.
